title: Coordination-cage binding and catalysed hydrolysis of organophosphorus chemical warfare agent simulants
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,26032-26042
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA04705B, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Burin Sudittapong, Christopher G. P. Taylor, James Williams, Rebecca J. Griffiths, Jennifer R. Hiscock, Michael D. Ward
Simulants of organophosphate chemical warfare agents can bind in the cavity of an octanuclear coordination cage (the figure shows a carbonate-based guest), resulting in some cases in catalysed hydrolytic decomposition.
